items.title: How bloated is your site?
items.content:
Frontend Focus

ğŸ‡ºğŸ‡¦ #â€‹533 â€” March 16, 2022 | Read on the web

New WebKit Features in Safari 15.4 â€” This is a big release from the Safari team, with support for several new web technologies, along with plenty of updates, and fixes. Expect details on lazy-loading, <dialog>, :has(), Cascade Layers, viewport units, focus-visible, accent-color, and muchÂ more.

Jen Simmons & Jon Davis (WebKit)

Ten Years of Page Bloat: What Have We Learned? â€” Just how big are pages today versus a decade ago? How does page bloat hurt your business? How does it affect Googleâ€™s Core Web Vitals? What can you do to fight it? This well-rounded post digs into all this (with plenty of visuals to help thingsÂ along).

Tammy Everts

Streamline and Evolve Your Workflows With Shortcut â€” All of your development work easily flows through Shortcut, from coding to review to release, and then to the bugs and the fixes that inevitably follow. Try project management for today's (and tomorrow's) softwareÂ team.

Shortcut (formerly Clubhouse.io) sponsor

'When' or 'If': A CSS Naming Debate â€” The CSS Working Group is currently considering a generic conditional/fallback structure (for things such @supports and @media) and is currently at something of a loggerheads over what, specifically, to name it. Eric outlines here how itâ€™s a thornier issue than you mightÂ expect.

Eric Meyer

WebGPU â€” All of the Cores, None of the Canvas â€” The WebGPU is an upcoming Web API that exposes a lot of capabilities of the client's GPU hardware. This post digs into how things work in excellent detail â€” now, thereâ€™s a bit of learning curve to all this, but Surma sets out to make it accessible, explaining how the API will prove beneficial toÂ us.. oneÂ day!

Surma

âš¡ï¸ Quick bits:

  • Here's a look at what's new in DevTools for Chrome 100, including the ability to view/edit @supports rules.
  • Firefox 98 is out, and here are the developer specific release notes. Say hello toÂ <dialog>!
  • CSS Tricks, a site we've linked to perhaps 2 squillion times so far (and yes, that is a real unit), has been accquired by DigitalOcean. Our congraulations to Chris Coyier and theÂ team.
  • Version 8.1 of developer browser Polypane is now available adding a new 'disable JS' debugging tool, a dimmed screen simulator, and perf fixes.
  • The U.S. has announced plans to make Daylight Savings Time permanent. This Twitter thread digs into some of the possible considerations for developers and programmers.
  • The American Council of the Blind, along with 180 other disability organizations, have signed a joint letter to the U.S. Department of Justice seeking enforceable online accessibility standards and digital regulations.

ğŸ“™ Tutorials, Articles & Opinion

Aligning Content In Different Wrappers â€” A look at how to align content with another section, across all viewport sizes, given that they are placed in different wrappers.

Ahmad Shadeed

â–¶Â Â Building VR and AR Experiences using HTML â€” Ada Rose Cannon from Samsung Internet chats with Jake Archibald of the Chrome team about VR & AR web standards, and how you can build immersive experiences usingÂ markup.

Google Chrome Developers

Making the 'Worldâ€™s Fastest Website', and Other Mistakes â€” An insightful look into some real-world performance considerations for a popular ecommerceÂ site.

Taylor Hunt

How to Use Rustlangâ€™s Async Tokio for CPU-Heavy Jobs â€” Yes, you can use Tokio for heavy data processing tasks â€” seeÂ how.

InfluxData sponsor

â–¶Â Â Create a Stunning 'Glassmorphism' Effect in CSS â€” A 15-minute step-by-step guide to creating immersive background effects using the backdrop-filter and background-clip CSSÂ properties.

Zoran Jambor

Donâ€™t Alienate Your User: A Primer for Internationalization & Localization â€” A look at how i18n and l10n can help you serve a wider audience: â€œThe web should be an inclusive place forÂ anyone.â€

Sophie Clifton-Tucker

â–¶Â Â Who Says HTML and CSS Aren't Real Programming? â€” Among other topics (including security, skills training), this half-hour episode touches upon how sites like MySpace, Tumblr, and the GeoCities of the world introduced an entire generation to coding. There's a transcriptÂ here if you'd prefer.

The Stack Overflow Podcast podcast

Animation Performance Fundamentals: How to Make Your Pages Look Smooth
Reza Lavarian

How Much CO2 Does Creating a 1,000-Word Piece of Content Cause? â€” Also how much wood would a woodchuck chuck if a woodchuck could chuck wood?
Gerry McGovern

How Many Hyperlinks Are Too Many for Accessibility?
Bureau of Internet Accessibility

Jobs

Fullstack Engineer (Remote, EU Timezones) â€” Weâ€™ve built a product thousands of people love (See Trustpilot if you donâ€™t believe us). We need your help with Node &Â TypeScript.
Feather

Senior Front-End Developer (Remote) â€” Get featured directly to tech companies hiring Frontend developers right now. Land an interview in as little as 24Â hrs.
Arc

Join the Remote Work Revolution â€” We offer the freedom of freelance with the security of full-time. Start working remotely with the worldâ€™s top clientsÂ today.
Toptal

ğŸ”§ Code, Tools & Resources

Fluent Icons: 4000+ Modern Open-Source Icons from Microsoft â€” This project is not affiliated with Microsoft, but itâ€™s a searchable website where you can find and download Microsoftâ€™s icons in various formats (PNG, SVG, etc).

Fayaz Ahmed

SingleFile: Browser Extension and CLI Tool to Save a Complete Page as a Single HTML File â€” Uses the WebExtensions API, so this is compatible with all the major modernÂ browsers.

gildas lormeau

Announcing Build Matrix

Buildkite sponsor

Animate CSS Grid: Painless Transitions for CSS Grid â€” A bit of an older project, but a neat effect, which you can try using this CodePenÂ demo.

Alex Holachek

HTMLShell: A Visual HTML Template Editor â€” Weâ€™ve seen lots of tools like this before, but this one has quite a few options to include various meta tags, stylesheets, analytics, and more â€” all easily toggled on orÂ off.

toptal

Nextacular: Open-Source Starter Kit to Quickly Launch Multi-Tenant SaaS Apps
Arjay Osma

Browser Vendors 'Working Together on Interop 2022' â€” A new collaboration from Apple, Bocoup, Google, Microsoft, Mozilla and others to improve interoperability of (mostly visual) web technologies. Thereâ€™s a dashboard here showing how various browser engines are doing across all focusÂ areas.

Jen Simmons (WebKit)

Say Hello to <selectmenu>, a Fully Style-able select Element â€” An introduction to this new, experimental form control called selectmenu, including how much easier it is to style than a traditionalÂ element.

Patrick Brosset

Filestack File Uploader & File Upload API â€” Advanced features include OCR, virus scanning & more. Get started with a freeÂ account.

Filestack sponsor

Taming CSS Variables with Web Inspector â€” CSS Custom Properties, better known as CSS variables, have been widely adopted by web designers to build reusable and configurable design systems. This post looks at how features in Safariâ€™s Web Inspector helps you work withÂ them.

Razvan Caliman

A New Speed Milestone for Chrome â€” How the â€˜M99â€™ release of Chrome saw substantial increases to the speed of Chrome across all majorÂ platforms. "Overall, since launching Chrome on M1-based Macs in late 2020, Chrome is now 43% faster than it was just 17 months ago!"

  • Here are the release notes for Safari Technology Preview Release 141, which adds support for overflow: clip.
  • Working with viewport heights can be a bit tricky, but we've got some new units on the way to help make things easier.
